title: Numerical outputs
body:
**Describe the bug**
I am getting mixed outputs in my files and I am not sure why. I have added and removed multiple features trying to track down the cause with no luck. Some of the results I receive are numeric, some are not, and some files just repeat the same result. 
Changing the inputs to category resolves the issue and I am fairly certain using sequential inputs work as well (tested previously).

I do not understand the difference between the results in runs 19 & 20. I would expect the files created in run 20 to mimic the previous files...i.e. run 19 accident_output returns mixed results but run 20 accident_output are all numeric. 

I am attaching the results from three experiments. 
First run (19) is a basic numeric to numeric and the data file was created by copying and pasting the data into a new csv file. 
Second run (20) are same files with no changes except for using the hdf files created by run19. I didn't even closed the command prompt. 
Third run I changed the inputs to category and received all numeric outputs as expected. (new hdf files)

Run 19
accident_output_predictions - mixed outputs beginning in Col A, Line 9
analyst_output_predictions - File repeats 4.89e-36
application_output_predictions  - mixed results
art_output_predictions - all numerics as desired
concept_output_predictions - mixed

Run 20
accident_output_predictions - all numerical as desired
analyst_output_predictions - File repeats 4.20e-13
application_output_predictions  - mixed results
art_output_predictions - numerical but repeats -0.00099 
concept_output_predictions - numerical as desired

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Load predict_syn3.csv and mdf_syn_numerical.yaml  file provided in link
2. Run experiment command
3. finish 
4. Run experiment command
5. Finish
6. Compare results between both runs

Please provide code, yaml definition file and a sample of data in order to entirely reproduce the issue.
Issues that are not reproducible will be ignored.

I have included everything I could think of from all the runs in a zipped file on onedrive. Let me know if you have any issues accessing the files since its my first time using it for guests. 

https://1drv.ms/u/s!AuPln-jFNoUohzfn-jK--mBwHIuj?e=1MNwxM

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

Expect all results to be consistent and numerical

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. iOS] Windows 10 
 - Version [e.g. 22] build 18363.900
- Python version 3.6
- Ludwig version 0.2.2.2
- Running in Conda environment
